Case Study

The BlackPink Trading Team

Four people. Four specialized AI personas. One OpenClaw gateway. Here's how they run a crypto trading operation entirely from their phones.

4 Team Members
4 AI Personas
1 OpenClaw Gateway
24/7 Always On

Meet the Team

The BlackPink team is a small, tight-knit group of traders and analysts who specialize in crypto markets. They don't work in an office ‚Äî they operate fully remotely, coordinating via Telegram group chats and relying heavily on their AI-powered tools to stay ahead of the market. Each team member has a dedicated OpenClaw workspace with a persona tuned for their specific role.

üåπ
Ros√©
Lead Strategist & Quant Bot Manager

Ros√© manages the team's flagship algorithmic trading bot ‚Äî Hydra. She's the one who writes and refines the bot's trading strategies, monitors its performance, and decides when to intervene manually. Her AI persona acts as a quant analysis partner and bot co-pilot.

AI Role: Hydra bot monitor, strategy advisor, Python code reviewer
üíÉ
Lisa
Technical Analyst

Lisa lives in chart patterns and price action. She focuses on technical analysis across multiple timeframes, identifying entry/exit signals for the team. Her AI persona is trained to think in terms of support/resistance, momentum indicators, and pattern recognition.

AI Role: Chart pattern analysis, indicator interpretation, signal generation
üå∏
Jisoo
News & Market Intelligence

Jisoo monitors the information landscape ‚Äî news, social sentiment, on-chain data, regulatory updates. She synthesizes large volumes of information into actionable intelligence. Her AI persona is a skilled researcher and summarizer with deep crypto market context.

AI Role: News summarization, sentiment analysis, regulatory research
üíé
Jennie
Portfolio Manager & Risk Officer

Jennie oversees the portfolio's overall health. She manages position sizing, monitors risk exposure, enforces stop-loss discipline, and ensures the team doesn't blow up chasing signals. Her AI is a conservative, numbers-focused risk analyst.

AI Role: Risk calculations, portfolio rebalancing, drawdown analysis

The Operation: What They're Actually Running

ü§ñ
Hydra Trading Bot

Hydra is an algorithmic trading bot running on a VPS, executing trades on crypto exchanges based on programmatic strategies. Ros√©'s OpenClaw instance connects directly to the bot's monitoring system. She can ask her AI things like "What's Hydra's P&L this week?" or "Check if the BTC momentum strategy is within normal parameters" ‚Äî and get instant analysis.

Powered by: Ros√©'s persona (quant + Python + trading systems expertise)
üìä
Real-Time Market Analysis

Lisa queries her AI throughout the trading day. She'll share a chart screenshot and ask for confluence analysis, or describe a pattern and ask what the historical win rate is for that setup. The persona has been tuned with Lisa's preferred indicators (EMA ribbons, RSI divergence, volume profile) so responses are immediately relevant.

Powered by: Lisa's persona (technical analysis specialist)
üì∞
News Intelligence Pipeline

Jisoo uses her AI to rapidly process news. She'll paste in an article and ask "How might this affect ETH in the next 48 hours?" or "Give me 5 bullet points on the key risk factors from this Fed speech." The persona understands crypto-macro connections and gives analysis in minutes instead of hours.

Powered by: Jisoo's persona (macro research + market intelligence)
üõ°Ô∏è
Risk Management Dashboard

Jennie checks in with her AI multiple times per day. She'll send the current portfolio snapshot and get a risk report back: overall exposure, concentration risks, current drawdown vs. maximum allowed, and recommended adjustments. The persona is configured to be the team's voice of caution.

Powered by: Jennie's persona (portfolio risk + position sizing)

How to Replicate This Setup

You don't need a 4-person team to benefit from this approach. Even as a solo trader or developer, you can create multiple personas for different tasks. Here's the basic blueprint:

01

Install OpenClaw and connect Telegram

Follow the install guide and Telegram guide. Get your base setup working before adding complexity.

02

Define your use case persona

Create a SOUL.md that's specific to how you trade. Include your preferred indicators, your risk tolerance, the markets you focus on, and your decision-making framework. See the persona guide for templates.

03

Set up a second workspace for a different role

Create a second directory (e.g., ~/.openclaw/workspace-risk/) with a different SOUL.md focused on risk management. You can run multiple OpenClaw instances pointing to different workspaces, each accessible through its own Telegram bot.

04

Build daily workflows

The team's secret weapon is consistency. Every morning they send structured updates to their AI and get structured briefings back. Make the AI part of your daily routine, not a last resort.

üéØ
This is within your reach. The BlackPink setup uses exactly the same tools described in this guide. No special access, no secret features ‚Äî just OpenClaw, a good SOUL.md, and the discipline to use it consistently. If they can run a multi-persona trading operation from their phones, so can you.
